articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: This time last year we were glowing at the dramatic win at Fir Park, which saw Luis Palma and Matt O’Riley score either side of a Motherwell goal in added time.  Luis scored two of our five Champions League goals last season and by Christmas looked like a successful summer buy. Form dropped off across the [...]
articles.title: Palma laying down a marker

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: GEORGE BALDOCK, who had been a Celtic target in July 2021, has tragically died at the age of 31. The Sheffield United right-back had been a priority signing aim for Ange Postecoglou shortly after he arrived at Parkhead to rebuild the squad. The £4million-rated Baldrock, however, stayed put at the Bramall Lane club, but eventually moved [...]
articles.title: FORMER CELTIC TARGET TRAGEDY

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS declared himself “satisfied” after watching Celtic overcome spirited Sligo Rovers 3-2 in a rousing friendly at the The Showground last night. Luis Palma neatly tucked away a late double to complete his hat-trick and rescue the Hoops from a loss against the fired-up League of Ireland outfit. Rodgers enjoyed the occasion, but had [...]

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC are hoping to emulate a 14-year record when they take on Aberdeen at Parkhead a week on Saturday. The last time the Hoops won their first eight league games was back in season 2010/11 when the team got off to a scorching start under Neil Lennon. Despite the wonderful sequence of victories, the side [...]
articles.title: CELTIC BEWARE: PERILS FROM THE PAST

articles.author: CQN Magazine

articles.title: PALMA’S 3-GOAL REMINDER IN LATE, LATE SHOW

articles.description: First, there was faux outrage that the Celtic – Aberdeen game later this month was not on TV.  Now, the sights have been trained on Celtic, who reserved their right to have five, instead of seven, home games shown on live TV. Sky Sport can broadcast up to five games from any ground.  This is [...]

articles.description: LISBON LION Jim Craig didn’t exactly hit the headlines when he made his first-team debut for Celtic FIFTY-NINE years ago. articles.description: I don’t know who started it, but by the day Nicolas Kuhn landed in Glasgow in January to complete his move to Celtic, the country’s biggest selling newspapers and commercial broadcaster were running “Honestly terrible” headlines about our prospective new winger. That verdict was proffered by a football fan from Austria, whose credentials in the [...]

articles.description: ALISTAIR JOHNSTON kick-started Celtic’s comeback in the nerve-shredding encounter with Ross County in Dingwall at the weekend. Nicolas Kuhn completed the spirited revival from the visitors with the points-clincher [...]

articles.title: REVEALED: KUHN EXPLAINS REASON FOR SNUBBING KYOGO

articles.description: Everything about Celtic in Dingwall yesterday betrayed the fact they suffered a demoralising reversal on Tuesday night.   The confidence visible in Perth 8 days earlier was replaced by hesitancy and misstep.  Ross County did not make it easy for them; the home side packed their defensive lines tightly, Celtic would need to earn any breakthrough. [...]

articles.description:
Homeward bound after a great wee midweek away day watching Celtic. A friendly against League of Ireland team Sligo Rovers may not have the same excitement for Celtic fans as a Champions League away trip. But any Celtic fan who was in Sligo yesterday could only be impressed by the welcome they received from the […]
